Name: Rebar (40,60,75,80 Grade Steel) - Reinforcing-Steel
EPDScope: Cradle-to-gate. Combination of electric arc furnace (EAF) / blast furnace averaged route. Includes all upstream manufacturing and transportation to the gate of the structual steel fabricator.
TreatmentEOL: 72% recycled (product has 70% scrap input, difference in mass results in EoL burden); 28% to landfill (ferro metal)

Name: Steel Bolt Assembly (General Use) - Hardware
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing steel fasteners. Bolt, washer, and nut were modeled as an assembly. The manufacturing process was modelled as follows steel wire rod/bar rolling-->screw hardening. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, lubricants production, process water production, and transportation of raw materials to manufacturing facility. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for screws is the same as recycling rate of structural steel. 72% recycled (product has 27.6% scrap input while remainder is processed and credited as avoided burden); 28% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Steel Bolt Assembly (Structural) - Hardware
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing steel fasteners. Bolt, washer, and nut were modeled as an assembly. The manufacturing process was modelled as follows steel wire rod/bar rolling-->screw hardening. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, lubricants production, process water production, and transportation of raw materials to manufacturing facility. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for screws is the same as recycling rate of structural steel. 72% recycled (product has 27.6% scrap input while remainder is processed and credited as avoided burden); 28% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Structural Steel (I-beams) - Structural Steel for Buildings
EPDScope: Cradle-to-gate. Electric arc furnace (EAF) route. Includes all upstream manufacturing and transportation.
TreatmentEOL: 97.5% recycled (product has 113% scrap input, difference in mass results in EoL burden); 2.5% to landfill (ferro metal)

Name: Anodized Aluminum Curtainwall Extrusion - Glazed Aluminum Curtain Walls
EPDScope: All materials input, from mining of bauxite through extrusion of the finished products, are included in the LCA model. The data comes a recent survey and report from the Aluminum Association and North American industry averages to describe various characteristics of the product, including recycling content, finishing, and alloying elements. The aluminum rod input into the extrusion process is modeled with an average post-consumer recycled content of 29%. The dataset accounts for average finishing processes, including anodized, painted, lacquered, and mill-finished options.
TreatmentEOL:
95% recovered (includes recycling, scrap preparation, and avoided burden credit); 5% landfilled (inert material). Distance to landfill: 20 miles.
Distance to recycling:100 miles.

Name: Double Pane IGU - Glass Glazing
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing double pane IGUs. The manufacturing energy for assembly of the double pane IGU was assumed to be 15 kWh/sqm of window unit (Athena 1999). Upstream data includes glass pane manufacture, energy production, chemicals production, aluminium production, and transportation of raw materials to manufacturing facility. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 100% to landfill. The assumption was made that the aluminum spacer (6.22%) is not recovered as it is integrated in the product and it is unlikely the product would be disassembled to recover this mass of aluminum.

Name: Drywall (Natural Gypsum) - Gypsum Board
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included; transportation of some minor materials is not included as it is unknown and falls below the cut-off criteria. Operating materials are likewise excluded as they are unknown and fall below the cut-off criteria.

Name: Ready Mix Concrete (BF Slag) (3,000 - 4,000 psi) - Cast-in-Place Concrete
EPDScope: 70% GGBFS mix. Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, transportation of ingredients to the concrete mixing plant, and plant operations. Transportation taken from averages, based on NRMCA report/survey (Athena 2014). Admixtures are not included. Dataset does not include any steel reinforcing or formwork. Slag is modeled from BF steel manufacturing using economic allocation.

Name: Ready Mix Concrete (Fly Ash) (3,000 - 4,000 psi) - Cast-in-Place Concrete
EPDScope: 35% fly ash mix. Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, transportation of ingredients to the concrete mixing plant, and plant operations. Transportation taken from averages, based on NRMCA report/survey (Athena 2014). Admixtures are not included. Dataset does not include any steel reinforcing or formwork. Fly ash is modeled from coal electricity production using economic allocation.

Name: Ready Mixed Concrete (LWC 3000-4000psi) - Cast-in-Place Concrete
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, transportation of ingredients to the concrete mixing plant, and plant operations. Transportation and plant operations taken from averages, based on NRMCA report/survey (Athena 2014). Admixtures are included. Dataset does not include any steel reinforcing or formwork.

Name: Ready Mixed Concrete (Straight Mix) (NWC 3000-4000psi) - Cast-in-Place Concrete
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, transportation of ingredients to the concrete mixing plant, and plant operations. Transportation and plant operations taken from averages, based on NRMCA report/survey (Athena 2014). Admixtures are not included. Dataset does not include any steel reinforcing or formwork.

Name: Drywall (FGD) - Gypsum Board
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included; transportation of some minor materials is not included as it is unknown and falls below the cut-off criteria. Operating materials are likewise excluded as they are unknown and fall below the cut-off criteria.

Name: Drywall (Mixed Gypsum) - Gypsum Board
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included; transportation of some minor materials is not included as it is unknown and falls below the cut-off criteria. Operating materials are likewise excluded as they are unknown and fall below the cut-off criteria.

Name: Type X Drywall - Gypsum Board
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included; transportation of some minor materials is not included as it is unknown and falls below the cut-off criteria. Operating materials are likewise excluded as they are unknown and fall below the cut-off criteria.
TreatmentEOL: 100% landfilled (3.3% paper waste, 96.7% inert material), Distance to landfill: 20 miles

Name: Cross Laminated Timber (CLT) (Engineered wood) - Engineered Wood Products
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, rough lumber production, and CLT manufacturing, including upstream transportation and resin production. Modeled from Athena 2013 LCA on CLT, 0.88% resin (polyurethane, emulsion polymer isocyanate, and acrilin melamine). Density = 475.45 kg/m3 @ 13% m.c.

Name: Glulam - Glued-Laminated Construction
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, and glulam manufacturing, including upstream transportation. Dataset represents US-CA industry average (AWC Glulam EPD) and has a density of 533.97 kg/m3 (oven dry). Composition from EPD: wood (98.5%), phenol resorcinol formaldehyde resin (1.25%), melamine urea formaldehyde resin (0.15%), polyurethane resin (0.07%), resorcinol formaldehyde resin (0.02%), melamine formaldehyde resin (0.01%).

Name: XPS Insulation (extruded polystyrene) - Exterior Insulation and Finish System
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, and transportation of ingredients to the plant. Polystyrene extruder foam (extruded polystyrol rigid foam XPS) is fabricated in a continous extrusion process:  polystyrene granulate is melted in an extruder and HCFC-134a is added as a foaming agent and HBCD is added as a flame retardant. The foam is then formed into the respective plastic construction part. The produced foam is homogenous and closed-cell and is offered in the form of plates. Installation and use phase are not included in the system boundary, but would have a significant impact because of the high GWP of the blowing agent.
TreatmentEOL: Due to addition of polybrominated flame retardant, assume 90.5% to landfill. Blowing agent (9.5%) released during use stage.

Name: Mineral Fiber Batt Insulation - Thermal Insulation
EPDScope: Includes raw materials acquistion, inbound transport of materials, and manufacturing, including packaging and waste treatment. Background study attributed zero burden to input of waste slag and excluded the energy required for crushing and sizing slag.

Name: Acoustical Ceiling Panels (FGD Gypsum) - Acoustical Panel Ceilings
EPDScope: The system boundary is the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of upstream materials, raw material aquistion, and energy extraction is included. FGD gypsum is a by-product of hard coal specific power plants and impacts associated with gypsum production are allocated ecomically. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 100% to landfill (95.45% to glass inert; 4.55% to paper)

Name: Acoustical Ceiling Panels (mineral fiber) - Acoustical Panel Ceilings
EPDScope: Includes raw materials acquistion, inbound transport of materials, and manufacturing. Packaging and waste treatment are included in the mineral fiber dataset, but are not included in the formulation as a whole. Background study for mineral fiber attributed zero burden to input of waste slag and excluded the energy required for crushing and sizing slag.

Name: Acoustical Ceiling Panels (Natural Gypsum) - Acoustical Panel Ceilings
EPDScope: The system boundary is the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of upstream materials, raw material aquisition, and energy extraction is included. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 100% to landfill (95.45% to glass inert; 4.55% to paper)

Name: Acrylic Flooring Adhesive - Flooring
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, inbound transportation, and energy for the production of epoxy resin adhesive. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Aluminum Primer - Epoxy Coatings
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including polymer production, chemicals extraction, and energy production. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for coating is the same as recycling rate of architectural aluminum. 95% recycled (burden associated with emissions from solvent evaporation; no burden or credit associated with other materials); 5% to landfill (25.59% plastic; 28.84% glass inert; 21.84% ferro metals; 22.47% xylene emissions; 1.25% ethyl benzene emissions).

Name: Bamboo Flooring (engineered) - Wood Flooring
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream bamboo cultivation, from planting through harvest, flooring manufacturing (strip making, pressing, cutting, sanding, and UV finish curing), including inbound transport and upstream material production. Final transportation from China is also included.  Wood residue produced, used for energy, allocated by mass.

Name: Carbon Steel Sprinkler Pipe - Fire-Suppression Sprinkler Systems
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Process steps are as follows: roll forming; welding, interior and exterior spray coating. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included; transportation of some minor materials is not included as it is unknown and falls below the cut-off criteria.  Packaging is not included.
TreatmentEOL: 72% recycled (product has 18.3% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden); 28% to landfill (ferro metal and plastics).

Name: Carpet Tile - Carpeting
EPDScope: Includes upstream material production, manufacturing, and inbound transportation. Packaging is excluded. Manufacturing includes tufting of nylon, nonwoven process for fiberglass, weaving of polypropylene backing, and coating application.
TreatmentEOL: 92.4% to landfill (plastic); 2.2% to incineration/waste-to-energy/cement kilns; 5.4% to recovery/reuse

Name: Cast Iron Pipes - Sanitary Waste and Vent Piping
EPDScope: Steel scrap, cast iron scrap and alloy components are melted in a cupola furnace. A model is formed in sand (as moulding material), the model is removed and the resting cavity effused with melted metal. The life cycle analysis of the grey iron part covers the cradle-to-gate phase. The system boundaries are represented by the finished product at the factory gate. Transports from the factory to the building site are not considered and must be included according to the system boundaries. In the present data set 100 per cent secondary material is assumed as basic material. Increased demand for steel scrap is satisfied with primary steel. Raw materials extraction, energy production, coating energy, and transportation of other raw materials to the plant are included. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 72% recycled (product has 100% steel scrap input); 28% to landfill (ferro metal and glass/inert).

Name: Cementitious Grouting - Cementitious Grouting
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction. Transportation of materials to the construction site and mixing of materials at the construction site are exluded as they are considered on-site construction operations and are outside of the scope of this study.
TreatmentEOL: 55% recycled into coarse aggregate (includes grinding energy and avoided burden credit); 45% landfilled (inert material)

Name: Chromate Pretreatment for Steel - Steel coatings
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Process steps include mixing of pre-treatment chemicals and passivation by dip coating. A coating weight of 11.45 ug/in2 was assumed based on research from CP100: Steel Conduit. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is assumed to be 500 km.  Packaging is not included.
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for coating is the same as recycling rate of structural steel. 72% recycled (no burden or credit associated with recycling); 28% to landfill (plastic). Distance to landfill: 20 mi; Distance to recycling: 100 mi

Name: Composite Metal Decking - Composite Metal Decking
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing composite metal decking. The final manufacturing step -- the roll forming and welding process -- takes place in a roll forming facility and includes the following processing steps to create the final product: Coil slitting-->Decoiling-->Embossing-->Pre-heating-->Roll forming-->Cutting-->Welding-->Packaging and loading. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, and zinc production, as well as transportation to the roll forming facility.
TreatmentEOL: 97.5% recycled (product has 48.3% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of zinc coating); 2.5% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Concrete cork expansion joint - Expansion Control
EPDScope: The cradle-to-gate system boundary includes production of cork flour from forest in Portugal, including cleaning, cooking, drying, shredding, and sorting, transport of the cork to the manufacturing facility; upstream production of auxillary inputs, fuel extraction, and manufacturing.
TreatmentEOL: 100% of waste is sent to landfill (70% landfill of wood products; 30% landfill of plastic products)

Name: Concrete Masonry Unit - Concrete Unit Masonry
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, transportation of ingredients to the CMU plant, and plant operations. Transportation taken from averages, based on NRMCA (2007) report/survey for aggregates and an estimate of 50 km for cement. Transportation of admixtures is excluded.

Name: Concrete Sealant - Concrete Finishing
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the mixing plant, and manufacturing energy. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Copper Piping - Steam and Condensate Heating Piping
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. This dataset is adapted from industry average data from European companies. Background data is US-specific, as is the clean scrap content used during the pipe fabrication. Copper cathode data is representative of a global average. The production route encompasses the following steps: mining and processing (concentrate production), hydrometallurgy (leaching, solvent extraction, electro winning) and pyrometallurgy (smelting, converting, fire refining, electrolytic refining). Copper cathodes are produced from both, the hydro- and the pyrometallurgical route. The semifabrication process for copper tube includes the process steps melting and alloying, extrusion and drawing. Raw materials for the production are copper ore and scrap (pyrometallurgy), as well as clean scrap (semifabrication).
TreatmentEOL: 65% of the copper tube is assumed to be recycled, with the remainder sent to landfill. The difference between recycled content and recycling rate is reflected as an environmental burden at EoL.

Name: Curtain wall seals - Rubber (ethylene propylene diene monomer) gasket - Joint gaskets
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the mixing plant, and manufacturing energy. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Drywall Acoustical Sealant - Acoustical Joint Sealant
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Manfacturing includes the mixing of sealant materials. Upstream data includes chemicals and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included.
TreatmentEOL: 19.33% solvent emissions to air (13.8% water vapour; 5.52% NMVOCs); 80.67% to landfill (53.9% inert and glass; 25.9% plastic)

Name: Drywall Joint Compound - Gypsum Plastering
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. The dry raw materials are pre-mixed in a dry blender. The premix is fed via weigh hopper and screw conveyor into wet blenders, either a paddle- or continuous-ribbon-type. Liquid ingredients are distributed through a piping system. Following blending, finished drywall joint compound is transferred into holding tanks by gravity or using pumps de-aerated under vacuum. Upstream data includes chemicals production, mineral extraction, and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included.
TreatmentEOL: 30% water vapour; 70% landfilled (65.6% inert material, 2.63% plastic waste, 1.81% biodegradable material)

Name: Drywall Joint Tape - Gypsum Plastering
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Production of joint tape and other paper for gypsum board frequently uses waste paper as a feedstock. There is no burden associated with waste paper. Upstream data includes chemicals production, and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included.

Name: Drywall Screws - Supports for Plaster and Gypsum Board
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing drywall screws. The manufacturing process was modelled as follows steel wire rod/bar rolling-->screw hardening-->phosphate conversion coating. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, lubricants and conversion coating chemicals production, process water production, and transportation of raw materials to manufacturing facility. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for screws is the same as recycling rate of structural steel. 72% recycled (product has 27.6% scrap input while remainder is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of zinc coating); 28% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Elastic Facade Joint Sealant - Elastomeric Joint Sealant
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Manfacturing includes the polymerization and mixing of sealant materials. Upstream data includes chemicals and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included.
TreatmentEOL: 6.74% solvent emissions to air (5.62% xylene; 1.12% ethyl benzene); 93.26% to landfill (56.4% plastic; 35.7% glass and inert; 0.06% metals)

Name: EPDM membrane roofing - Ethylene-Propylene-Diene-Monomer Roofing
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients, and manufacturing energy, including extrusion and vulcanization of EPDM membranes. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Epoxy flooring adhesive - Flooring
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, inbound transportation, and energy for the production of epoxy resin adhesive. Packaging is excluded.

Name: EPS Insulation - Foamed-in-Place Insulation
EPDScope: The foam is produced from a normal plastic which is turned into a porous material by inflating it with a blowing agent. The plastic, which is expandable polystyrene, is manufactured by suspension polymerization of polystyrene. Small EPS beads are formed. After that a blowing agent is added. This can be a low- boiling hydrocarbon like pentane or butane. The foaming process takes place in three steps: prefoaming, intermediate storage, final foaming. During the first step, the plastic beads are heated and softened. The blowing agent evaporates and bubbles filling the plastic and increasing the bead diameter are formed. In the second step, another molding process takes place, in which air is used as an additional blowing agent and allows the material to withstand the external atmospheric pressure when the finished part is removed from the mold. In the third step, perforated molds are filled with the prefoamed beads and exposed to steam. The beads expand and fill the pores. The temperature range during prefoaming and final foaming is from 85 to 120°C. To achieve flame- proof foams, the surface can be coated with organobromine compounds like hexabromocyclododecane. Release of blowing agent during production is included.
TreatmentEOL: Due to addition of polybrominated flame retardant, assume 98.0% to landfill (plastic). All blowing agents released during use stage.

Name: Exterior Door w/ IGU - Stainless-Steel Doors
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing steel door. The final manufacturing step includes the following processing steps to create the final product: Steel door skin stamping and bending-->Punching-->Spot welding-->Lamination of door skins to EPS foam with hot melt polyurethane adhesive-->Double Pane IGU insertion-->Polyseter Powder Coating. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, paper manufacturing, energy production, and chemicals production, as well as transportation to the manufacturing facility.
TreatmentEOL: 74% steel (72% recycling rate: product has 33% steel scrap input but 16.5% comes from manufacturing processes; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden, 37%); 26% to landfill (plastics, and glass/inert)

Name: Fiber Glass Board Insulation - Duct Insulation
EPDScope: The composition of the duct board is 81% fiberglass, 12% binder, and 7% facing materials. The cradle-to-gate includes raw materials acquisition, inbound transport of materials, and manufacturing, including packaging and waste treatment. Manufacturing includes the following stages batch-->melter-->binder-->finishing-->facing. Cradle-to-gate results include plant overhead.  Background study excluded any processing of recycled cullet due to lack of data.

Name: Fire-retardant Treated/PT Lumber - Treated Wood Foundations
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing PT lumber. This includes upstream production of material inputs, inbound transportation, and final energy requirements for pressure treatment.

Name: Firestop joint spray - Building Perimeter Firestopping
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Manfacturing includes the mixing of sealant materials. Upstream data includes chemicals and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included. Packaging and application are not included.
TreatmentEOL: 100% to landfill (30% water vapour; 70% plastic landfill)

Name: Flame retardant polyurethane foam window/door seal - Compression Seals
EPDScope: The cradle-to-gate system boundary includes manufacturing energy of open cell polyurethane foam, acrylic impregnating agent, pressure sensitive adhesive, release paper, transport of raw materials to the manufacturing facility, upstream production of auxillary inputs, and raw material and fuel extraction.
TreatmentEOL: 100% landfill (93.9% to plastic landfilll; 6.1% to paper landfill)

Name: Fluid-Applied Flooring - Resilient Flooring
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production,and transportation of ingredients to the plant. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Fluid-applied rubber asphalt roofing - Fluid-Applied Roofing
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including upsteam chemical production and energy extraction, and high shear mixing. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.

Name: Foundation dampproofing - Dampproofing
EPDScope: The system boundary includes the ingredients, transportation of those ingredients to a mixing facility, and the heating of the bitumen. The petroleum ingredients are assumed to be sourced from regional refineries and transported via truck; the attapulgite is sourced from Georgia and travels cross-country via rail. Mixing of the ingredients is estimated based on the heating value of bitumen and the accompanying combustion of natural gas.
TreatmentEOL: All material is sent to the landfill and assumed to be inert.

Name: Foundation waterproofing sheet membrane - Membrane Concrete Curing
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the plant, and manufacturing energy of the membrane and its component parts. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Foundation waterproofing sheet primer - Membrane Concrete Curing
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the mixing plant, and manufacturing energy. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Galvanized Steel Ducts - Metal Ducts
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing galvanized steel ducts. Steel is galvanized by a hot dip galvanization process. The final manufacturing process includes the following processing steps to create the final product: Stamping-->Bending. The ducts are joined by a lock seam, and it was assumed there is no welding. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, zinc production, and transportation of raw materials to the production facility. A transportation distance of 500 km is assumed. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 97.5% recycled (product has 41.1% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of zinc coating); 2.5% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Glass Fiber Reinforced Polymer Decking - Glass-Fiber-Reinforced Plastic
EPDScope: The system is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all upstream raw material production, energy extraction, and transportation. Manufacuturing includes granulate compounding and pulltrusion of the composite material and polyester veil. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 100% to landfill (58.64% to glass/inert, 41.4% to plastic) Because of current challenges with recycling of glass fiber reinforced polymers, a worst case scenario of 100% to landfill was assumed. As commercial scale recycling of GFRP becomes feasible, this assumption should be revised.

Name: Glass Fiber Reinforced Polymer Water Storage Tank - Facility Potable-Water Storage Tanks
EPDScope: The system is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all upstream raw material production, energy extraction, and transportation. Manufacuturing includes granulate compounding; fiber manufacturing; hand-laying emissions; and filament winding of structural layers. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 100% to landfill (64% glass; 36% to plastic) Because of current challenges with recycling of glass fiber reinforced polymers, a worst case scenario of 100% to landfill was assumed. As commercial scale recycling of GFRP becomes feasible, this assumption should be revised.

Name: Granular Fill - Cast Decks and Underlayment
EPDScope: The system boundary includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, recycled material processing, and inbound transportation of ingredients. Transportation taken from averages, based on NRMCA report/survey (Athena 2014).
TreatmentEOL: 50% recycled (product has 50% recycled content); 50% to landfill (inert materials)

Name: Gypsum Spray Fireproofing - Applied Fireproofing
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Manfacturing includes the mixing of fireproofing materials. Upstream data includes chemicals and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Hardwood Flooring (prefinished) - Wood Flooring
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, and flooring manufacturing, including upstream transportation. The electricity for UV-curing is included.

Name: HDPE Municipal Water Pipe - Domestic Water Piping
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including upsteam chemical production, energy extraction, and pipe extrustion. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.

Name: High performance coating (epoxy) - High-Performance Coatings
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. The production route encompasses the following steps: production of epoxy resin, mixing of epoxy resin and epoxy activator/hardener, and spray application of high performance epoxy coating.
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for coating is the same as recycling rate of structural steel. 72% recycled (no burden or credit associated with recycling); 28% to landfill (plastic).

Name: High Performance Coatings (Acrylic) - High-Performance Coatings
EPDScope: The system is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all upstream raw material production, energy extraction, final material production and inbound transportation. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Hydrophilic Concrete Joint Waterstop - Waterstops
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the extrusion plant, and manufacturing energy. Packaging is excluded.

Name: IGU Silicone Sealant - Elastomeric Joint Sealant
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction and energy production. Manufacturing of IGU silicone sealant occurs by the following process steps: hydrolysis, distillation, and polymerization. In this process appropriated organochlorosilanes are used as precursors (dimethyldichlorosilane, trimethyldichlorosilane and phenylmethylsiloxane). Silicon fluids with low viscosity is the main product and the following products also occur: Linear polyorganiosiloxanes with high viscosity, cyclic polyorganosiloxane/siloxane (cyclic). The impacts of the co-products were allocated by market value.
TreatmentEOL: Assume 0% recycling rate at end-of-life. 100% to landfill (plastic).

Name: Intumescent firestop sealant - Fire-Resistant Joint Sealants
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Manfacturing includes the mixing of sealant materials. Upstream data includes chemicals and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included.

Name: Kraft-faced Fiber Glass Batt Insulation - Blanket Insulation
EPDScope: The composition is 83% fiberglass, 8% binder, and 9% facing materials. The cradle-to-gate includes raw materials acquisition, inbound transport of materials, and manufacturing, including packaging and waste treatment. Manufacturing includes the following stages batch-->melter-->binder-->finishing-->facing. Cradle-to-gate results include plant overhead.  Background study excluded any processing of recycled cullet due to lack of data.

Name: Laminated Glass - Glass Glazing
EPDScope: Included in the system boundary is upstream material and energy production, inbound transporation, and manufacturing. Manufacturing includes the energy for annealing of the glass and lamination with the PVB interlayer, followed by heating in an autoclave. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Linoleum Flooring - Resilient Flooring
EPDScope: Cradle-to-gate system boundary includes impacts associated with upstream material production, inbound transport, and on-site manufacturing. The majority, if not all, of US linoleum is imported from Europe (Linoleum Imports), therefore transport from Europe is included though further distribution within the US falls outside the scope. Product composition from industry average EPD (ERFMI EPD): additives, 9.5%; filler, 16%; flame retardant, 2.5%; pigments, 3.9%; linseed oil, jute, wood/cork flour, 57.7%;auxiliaries, 0.2%; lacquer, 0.7%; flooring recyclate (linoleum), 9.6%.
TreatmentEOL:
100% to landfill (biodegradable). 
Recycling is un-likely as production is in the EU while the consumer is in the US. While composting and incineration are both viable disposal routes for linoleum, information on their respective rates in the US is unavilable.

Name: Liquid-applied moisture barrier - Fluid-Applied Membrane Air Barrier
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including upsteam chemical production and energy extraction. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.

Name: Low VOC Eggshell Acrylic Paint - Interior Painting
EPDScope: The system is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all upstream raw material production, energy extraction, manufacturing, and inbound transportation. Packaging is exclude.

Name: Medium Density Fiberboard (MDF) - Wood Panel Product Sheathing
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, and medium density fiberboard manufacturing, including upstream transportation. Dataset represents US-CA industry average (Medium Density FiberboardEPD) and has a urea formaldehyde resin content of 9.54%, a urea content of 0.11%, a melamine urea formaldehyde resin content of 0.10%, a scavenger content of 0.20%, a catalyst content of 0.01%, a slack wax content of 0.57% and density of 745.95 kg/m3 (oven dry).

Name: Membrane roofing adhesives - Membrane Roofing
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the mixing plant, and manufacturing energy. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 21.7% to landfill (plastic material); 78.3% solvents released during application (burden not included)

Name: Metal Ceiling Tile - Acoustical Tile Ceilings
EPDScope: Cradle-to-gate system boundary includes upstream material production, inbound transportation, and facility manufacturing, including powder coating application and stamping and bending of the aluminum.
TreatmentEOL: 98% Coated aluminum recovered (includes recycling, scrap preparation, and avoided burden credit), 5% landfilled (inert material); 2% backing to landfill (35% plastic, 34% biodegradable, 31% inert). Remainder to landfill. Distance to landfill: 20 miles. Distance to recycling:100 miles.

Name: Oriented strand board - Wood Board Sheathing
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, and plywood manufacturing, including upstream transportation. Dataset represents US-CA industry average (OSB EPD) and has a phenol formaldehyde resin content of 3.4%, a methylene diphenyl di-isocyanate (MDI) resin content of 0.5%, a slack wax content of 1.6%, and density of 633.84 kg/m3 (oven dry).

Name: Particleboard - Wood Panel Product Sheathing
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, and particleboard manufacturing, including upstream transportation. Dataset represents US-CA industry average (Particleboard EPD) and has a density of 709.79 kg/m3 (oven dry).

Name: PEX Water Pipe - Domestic Water Piping
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including upsteam chemical production, energy extraction, and pipe extrustion. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.

Name: Pipe Insulation - Plumbing Piping Insulation
EPDScope: Includes upstream material production, transport to manufacturing, energy and fugitive emissions (from blowing agent) associated with manufacturing. Packaging is excluded. Any blowing agent emissions during installation or use phases are excluded, and could represent a significant impact due to the high SFP of the blowing agent.
TreatmentEOL: Assumes all blowing agent released before decommisioning, remaining amount landfilled (84% plastic, 11% inert)

Name: Pipe Insulation Adhesives - Plumbing Piping Insulation
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Manfacturing includes the extrusion of chloroprene rubber and mixing of materials. Upstream data includes chemicals and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included. Packaging and application are not included.

Name: Pipe Thread Sealant - Facility Water Distribution
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Manfacturing includes the mixing of sealant materials. Upstream data includes chemicals and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included.

Name: Plywood - Prefinished Plywood Paneling
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, and plywood manufacturing, including upstream transportation. Dataset represents US-CA industry average (Plywood EPD) and has a phenol formaldehyde resin content of 2.1% and density of 491.2 kg/m3 (oven dry).

Name: PMMA Countertop - Countertops
EPDScope: System boundary includes upstream material production, energy generation, and inbound transport. Manufacutring includes plastic injection molding. Curing is assumed to happen at room temperature and therefore no energy is required. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Polycarbonate Cladding - Structured-Polycarbonate-Panel Assemblies
EPDScope: The system is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all upstream raw material production, energy extraction, and transportation. Manufacuturing includes granulate compounding and co-extrusion of the core and UV layer. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Polyester Powder Coating - Steel coatings
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the plant, manufacturing of powder coating, and coating by electrostatic deposition. Manufacturing of powder coating occurs by the following process steps: mixing, extrusion, milling. Coating density and efficiency were determined based on the application rate of 0.0826 kg polyester powder coating per 1 sqm steel from CP100: Steel Conduit.
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for coating is the same as recycling rate of structural steel. 72% recycled (no burden or credit associated with recycling); 28% to landfill (plastic).

Name: Polypropylene Water Pipe - Domestic Water Piping
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including upsteam chemical production, energy extraction, and pipe extrustion. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.

Name: Polyurethane flooring adhesive - Flooring
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of raw ingredients, and polyurethane manufacturing. Polyurethanes are produced by continually combining the raw materials iso-cyanide and polyol components, which combine in an exothermic reaction to produce teh polyurethane product. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Polyvinyl chloride membrane roofing - Polyvinyl-Chloride Roofing
EPDScope: The system is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all upstream raw material production, energy extraction, and transportation. PVC is produced by polymerisation of vinyl chloride monomer to polyvinyl chloride PVC. It can be produced by bulk, emulsion and suspension polymerisation. In this balance the presently dominating suspension polymerisation is considered. In general the polymerisation reaction is initiated by free radicals and runs under temperatures of 40 to 70 °C. Today the suspension polymerisation is preferred, which takes place in an aqueous solution. After polymerising monomers are expelled as far as economically possible, the PVC is further manufactured by centrifugation and dried in an air flow of 80°C. Packaging is excluded.

Name: PVDF-Coated Aluminum Curtainwall Extrusion - Glazed Aluminum Curtain Walls
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including upsteam chemical production, aluminum producstion and extrusiton, energy extraction, and coating. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.
TreatmentEOL: 95% Coated aluminum recovered (includes recycling, scrap preparation, and avoided burden credit), 5% landfilled (plastic material). Distance to landfill: 20 miles. Distance to recycling:100 miles.

Name: Roof edge flashing - Plastic Sheet Flashing
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including coating production and application, metal production and bending, and energy production. Inbound transportation of upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.
TreatmentEOL: 33.3% coated aluminum [95% recycled (product has 60% aluminum scrap input; the remainder of aluminum scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of coating); 5% to landfill (1% plastic; 0.9% glass inert)], 66.7% galvanized steel [97.5% recycled (product has 39.2% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of zinc coating, 3.4%); 2.5% to landfill (ferro metal)]

Name: Solvent Weld Soil and Waste Pipe - Sanitary Wate Piping Specialties
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing polyvinyl chloride (PVC) waste pipe. The manufacturing process was modelled based as follows compounding of raw materials-->PVC pipe extrusion. Upstream data includes virgin PVC production, lubrianct, stabilizer, pigment, filler, and processing aid production, energy production, and transportation of raw materials to manufacturing facility. Downstream data includes landfilling of municipal solid waste. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: Recovery rate of PVC in the United States is 0% [EPA, 2014]; 100% to landfill

Name: Spray Foam Insulation - Sprayed Insulation
EPDScope: The cradle-to-gate system boundary includes upstream production of material inputs, inbound transport, and production at the manufacturing facility. The insulation is applied on-site and therefore there is no burden from the blowing agent being released during installation or off-gassing during the use stage.
TreatmentEOL: Assumes no blowing agent remains in product at decommisioning, remainder of product (94%) sent to landfill (plastic).

Name: Steel Conduit - Grounding and Bonding for Electrical Systems
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing coated steel conduit. The manufacturing process involves roll forming galvanized steel coil and welding the seam. The polyester powder and chromate coatings are modeled by CP039: Polyester Powder Coating for Steel and CP038: Chromate pre-treatment for steel,respectively. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing and galvanization, energy production, chromate production and application, polyster powder production and application, and transportation of raw materials to the production facility. A upstream material transportation distance of 500 km is assumed. Packaging is exluded.
TreatmentEOL: 72% recycled (product has 48% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of zinc coating); 28% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Steel Door - Stainless-Steel Doors
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing steel door. The final manufacturing step includes the following processing steps to create the final product: Steel door skin stamping and bending-->Punching-->Core insertion-->Spot welding-->Phosphate Coating-->Polyseter Powder Coating. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, paper manufacturing, energy production, and chemicals production, as well as transportation to the roll forming facility.
TreatmentEOL: 72% recovery rate of product (product has 4.23% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden (58%); the paper and contact adhesive content is landfilled); 28% to landfill (ferro metal, plastics, and paper).

Name: Steel Pipe Hanger - Hangers and Supports for Plumbing Piping and Equipment
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing electro-galvanized steel pipe hangers. The final manufacturing process includes the following processing steps to create the body of the hanger: Stamping-->Bending-->Punching.  1.31% cuttings in relation to steel sheet input for the punching was assumed, based on the diameters of the holes needed for the cross bolt and rod. The cross bolt is modeled by CP018:Steel fasteners. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, zinc production, lubricants production, and transportation of raw materials to the production facility. A transportation distance of 500 km is assumed. Packaging is exluded.
TreatmentEOL: 72% recycled (product has 13.9% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of zinc coating); 28% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Steel Studs - Metal Furring
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing steel studs. The final manufacturing step -- the roll forming process for the production of steel stud and track -- takes place in a roll forming facility and includes the following processing steps to create the final product: Uncoiling --> Slitting --> Recoiling --> Roll forming. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, and lubricants production, as well as transportation to the roll forming facility. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 97.5% recycled (product has 45% scrap input while remainder is processed and credited as avoided burden); 2.5% to landfill (ferro metal). Distance to landfill: 20 mi; Distance to recycling: 100 mi

Name: Structural Steel Cables - Steel Wire Rope Assemblies
EPDScope: System boundary includes upstream material production, energy generation, and inbound transport. Production includes hot dip galvanization of steel, spray application of zinc-rich blocking compound, and wire twisting. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 97.5% recycled (product has 24% steel scrap input; the remainder of steel scrap is processed and credited as avoided burden; no credit is given for the recycling of zinc/aluminum coating); 2.5% to landfill (ferro metal).

Name: Sub-Floor Smoothing Compound - Subflooring
EPDScope: The system boundary includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, transportation of ingredients to the sub-floor smoothing compound mixing plant, and plant operations. Transportation data taken from Athena (2014) report/survey. Mixing energy taken from Athena (1998).
TreatmentEOL: 55% of the smoothing compound assumed to be recycled, with the remaining 45% going to landfill.

Name: Thermoplastic polyolefin (TPO) membrane roofing - Thermoplastic-Polyolefin Roofing
EPDScope: The system boundary is defined as cradle-to-gate and ends with the finished product at the factory gate. Includes all cradle-to-gate data including upsteam chemical production, energy extraction, and pipe extrustion. Inbound transportation of significant upstream materials is included. Packaging is not included.

Name: Thin Film Intumescent Coating - Steel Coatings
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, transportation of ingredients to the plant, manufacturing (mixing) of coating, and spray coating. Coating density and efficiency were determined based on the application rate of 0.927 kg polyester powder coating per 1 sqm steel (S605).
TreatmentEOL: Assume recycling rate for coating is the same as recycling rate of structural steel. 72% recycled (no burden or credit associated with recycling); 28% to landfill (plastic).

Name: Vapor barrier - Bentonite Waterproofing
EPDScope: Includes all cradle-to-gate data, including raw materials extraction, energy production, film extrusion, and transportation of ingredients to the plant. Packaging is excluded.

Name: Vinyl Composition Tile - Resilient Flooring
EPDScope: Cradle-to-gate system boundary includes upstream raw material production, on-site manufacturing, and upstream transportation. Packaging is included. Composition from industry average EPD (RFCI VCT EPD): dolomite, limestone, 84.1%;polyvinyl chloride, 11.3%; DOTP, 3.5%; various additives, 0.8%; other components, 0.8%.

Name: Welded Wire Mesh Concrete Reinforcement - Welded Wire Fabric Reinforcing
EPDScope: The system boundaries comprise the cradle-to-gate process for manufacturing welded wire mesh reinforcement. The final manufacturing step -- the welding of individual wires -- assumes an average of 16 spot welds per kg of steel, based on common wire mesh reinforcement sizes and spacings (source: Manual). The 16 welds represents a mesh with 6x6in. (152mm x 152mm) openings and 0.04 (26mm x 26mm) diameter wire. Upstream data includes steel manufacturing, energy production, and spot welding energy requirements, as well as transportation to the roll forming facility. Packaging is excluded.
TreatmentEOL: 72% recycled (product has 28% scrap input while remaineder is processed and credited as avoided burden); 28% to landfill (ferro metal)

Name: Wood Framing - Wood Framing
EPDScope: The system boundary includes upstream forest operations, from planting through harvest, and plywood manufacturing, including upstream transportation, as well as upstream production of anti-sapstain treatment. Dataset represents US-CA industry average (Softwood Lumber EPD) and a density of 433.57 kg/m3 (oven dry).

Name: Brick - Generic brick
EPDScope: A1-A3, C4, D (missing C1, C2 and C3).

Name: Oppdal Quartzite Schist (sawn edges)- Stone - Stone
Natural Stone Cladding - Stone
